item.description:
Yes, I am breaking up the Bonds. I would like to do Bond and West Bond via Zealand and Zeacliff to do a little "exploring" and perhaps at another date hike Bondcliff /Bond via Bondcliff.

We will enter and exit the wilderness via the relatively flat Zealand Trail. The real hike begins at Zealand Hut, where we will take the Ethan Pond trail to the steep and less-often-used Zeacliff trail to begin the ascent. Zeacliff provides the opportunity to view Carrigain Notch and the Zeacliff outlook. The Zeacliff trail will bring us to the Twinway, which we will follow from Zealand over to Guyot. On Guyot, at the junction of the Twinway and Bondcliff, we will turn left onto Bondcliff and ascend Mt Bond. On the return, we will bear left at the junction with West Bond Spur and ascend West Bond. We will then follow the Twinway back to the Zealand Hut. Book Time is approximately 13hr 30 minutes. I would like to do it a bit faster than book time so please only sign up for this hike if you are familiar with the terrain and can hike faster than book time along some of the easier sections of this hike (Zealand Trail, Ethan Pond and relatively moderate parts of the Twinway).

We will meet at the Zealand Trailhead on Zealand Road at 7am. Because this is a LONG hike, I expect that everyone will bring a flashlight and/or headlamp, just in case.

If anyone has done this and has comments or suggestions, please post them for everyone's benefit!
-------------------
Partially Plagerized from my White Mountain Guide Book for your benefit

Zealand Trail (Enter)
2.5 mi
1hr 40 minutes
Mostly flat, following old railroad grade. I just did this this week.

Ethan Pond Trail (We would do this SECTION of the trail IN REVERSE)
40 min
1.3 mi
"....follows an old railroad grade on a gradual cruve into Zealand Notch with its steep, fire-scarred walls. As the trail crosses the talus slopes of Whitewall Mtn, it comes into the open with fine views...in the middle of this section the Zeacliff Trail diverges..The Ethan Pond Trail soon reenters the woods and continues on the remains of the railroad grade (which is badly washed out in places) to the junction with Zealand Trail and the Twinway. For Zealand Falls Hut turn sharp left onto the Twinway and follow it for .2 miles.

Zeacliff Trail
1.4 miles
1500 ft
1hr 25 min
This trail runs from the Ethan Pond Trail 1.3 miles south of its junction with Zealand Pond to the Twinway .1 mi west of the Zeacliff outlook. It is an attractive trail, much less frequently used than most trails in this area, but extremely steep and rough in parts and not recommended for hikers with heavy packs...The trail leaves the Ethan Pond Trail and descends west over open talus, then drops very steeply to cross Whitewall Brook at .2 mi. It then climbs very steeply up an old slide at first. The grade eases up at .6 miles and soon the trail reaches the top of the ridge, where it ascends gradually through a beautiful birch forest, then swings left and angles up to a rock face at 1.1 miles. The main trail turns right here and ascends steeply to the right of the rock face, then swings right, passes an outlook toward Carrigain Notch and rejoins the main trail. Above this point, the trail ascends steeply to the ridgecrest and the Twinway.


Twinway (Ascent)
2.9 Miles
2 hrs

"...The trail (at the junction with Zeacliff) then ascends over several ledgy humps and crosses a sag at 1.9 miles, where a side path leads off to the left and reaches the shore of Zeacliff Pond in .1 mile. The main trail ascends a rather steep pitch with a ladder to a ledge overlooking the pond, then continues along the crest of the ridge over several wooded knowbs. At 3.1 miles, just after crossing the height-of-land on the last of these knobs, it reaches a small cairn marking a side path on the right that runs nearly level .1 mi to the true summit of Zealand Mtn. The main trail descends sharply to a col then climbs moderately up the long ridge to Mt. Guyot, breaking into the open just as it reaches the summit. It then descends a short distance over open rocks to the junction with the Bondcliff Trail on the left at 4.4 miles."


Bondcliff (We would do this section of the trail IN REVERSE)
1.3 mi
55 minutes
..."summit of Mt. Bond which commands a magnificent unrestricted view of the surrounding wilderness and mountains. The trail descends North, crossing a minor knob, then drops down rather steeply past the spur path to West Bond...and leaves the Pemigewasset Wilderness. It reaches the Bond-Guyot col...where a spur path descends right...to Guyot Campsite and its spring. The Bondcliff Trail then ascends to the bare south summit of Mt Guyot and continues in the open .2 miles to its junction with the Twinway .1 miles west of the higher, but less open, north summit of Guyot."

West Bond Spur
.5 miles
200 ft
20 minutes
This short path provides access to the sharp rocky summit of the West Peak of Mt. Bond, which is perched high above the deep valleys of an extensive wilderness area, commanding magnificent views. The entire trail is in the Pemigewasset Wilderness. It leaves the Bondcliff trail .6 mi north of the summit of Mt. Bond and .3 mi south of the spur to Guyot Campsite, descends moderately for .3 mil to the col at the foot of West Bond and ascends moderately for a short distances. It then climbs the steep cone to the summit, which is the most easterly of several small peaks on a ridge running east and west.

Twinway (Descent)(We would do this section of the trail IN REVERSE)
4.4 Miles
2400'
3hrs 25 min
At the junction of Zealand and Ethan Pond trails, the Twinway crosses the outlet of Zealand Pond, then climbs steeply on rock steps to Zealand Falls Hut, passing a side path left to a viewpoint for Zealand
Falls. it then ascends moderately, passing a junction on the right with the Lend-A-Hand Trail just before it crosses two branches of Whitewall Brook on ledges, and continues to climb steadily through a
fine forest of birches toward the crest of Zealand Ridge. At 1.4 miles, where the trail levels off and swings right, a loop side path continues straight ahead, passing over the magnificent Zeacliff outlook and rejoining the main trail 50 yards west of its point of departure. The Twinway passes a junction with the Zeacliff Trail on the left, then ascends over several ledgy humps and crosses a sag at 1.9 miles, where a side path leads off to the left and reaches the shore of Zeacliff Pond in .1 mile. The main trail ascends a rather
steep pitch with a ladder to a ledge overlooking the pond, then continues along the crest of the ridge over several wooded knowbs. At 3.1 miles, just after crossing the height-of-land on the last of these knobs, it reaches a small cairn marking a side path on the right that runs nearly level .1 mi to the true summit of Zealand Mtn. The main trail descends sharply to a col then climbs moderately up the long ridge to Mt. Guyot, breaking into the open just as it reaches the summit. It then descends a short distance over open rocks to the junction with the Bondcliff Trail on the left at 4.4 miles.

Zealand Trail (Exit)
2.5 mi
1hr 40 minutes
Mostly flat, following old railroad grade. I just did this this week.



DISCLAIMER (SHAMELESSLY PLAGERIZED FROM ANOTHER MEETUP HIKER): MY ROLE AS ORGANIZER IN THIS HIKE IS SOCIAL. I AM NOT TRAINED TO BE A GUIDE, NOR HAVE I RECEIVED TRAINING OR INSTRUCTION IN HIKING SAFETY. WHILE I TRY TO HEAD OFF SOME OF THE PROBLEMS I HAVE SEEN IN THE PAST, MY UNDERSTANDING IS THAT YOU WILL TAKE RESPONSIBILITY FOR YOUR OWN SAFETY. IF MY DISAPPEARANCE DURING THIS TRIP WOULD CAUSE YOU MORE THAN ANNOYANCE AND INCONVENIENCE, THIS IS NOT THE TRIP FOR YOU. THERE ARE ALWAYS RISKS IN HIKING IN THE MOUNTAINS. IF YOU ARE NOT CONFIDENT THAT YOU UNDERSTAND THE RISKS, PLEASE DO NOT SIGN UP (or change your RSVP to no). I AM PERFECTLY CAPABLE OF MAKING STUPID OR MINDLESS MISTAKES, SO PLEASE DO YOUR OWN RESEARCH AND COME PREPARED WITH APPROPRIATE KNOWLEDGE, EQUIPMENT AND JUDGMENT.
